snippet: Taliban fighters stormed a prison in the town of Bannu early Sunday, freeing almost 400 prisoners, including a militant commander who had tried to assassinate Gen. Pervez Musharraf.
abstract: Taliban fighters storm prison in Bannu, Pakistan, freeing almost 400 prisoners; raid is billed as the biggest jailbreak in Pakistani history.

byline.original: By ISMAIL KHAN and DECLAN WALSH
byline.contributor: Ihsanullah Tipu Mehsud contributed reporting from Islamabad.

lead_paragraph: Taliban fighters stormed a prison in the town of Bannu early Sunday, freeing almost 400 prisoners, including a militant commander who had tried to assassinate Gen. Pervez Musharraf.

headline.seo: Pakistani Taliban Assault Prison, Freeing Almost 400
